title: Validation
text: Two step procedure following international recommendations (ICP 2021, 26) (World Bank 2013, 249), trying identify eliminate non-sampling,1 production errors underlying data. Intra-regional validation: prices collected edited verified within region territorial area Inter-region validation: prices validation across regions/countries, ensuring average prices based comparable products across countries products accurately priced.

title: Validation
text: product, Price Observation Table obtained, containing characterisation individual product well two individual price outlier statistics, Ratio--average price test t-value test; see World Bank (2013), table 9.1a extensive example. Ratio--average price test: ratio individual price observation ii, PiP_{}, specific product jj observed average price product, μj\mu_j. observed price passes test ratio 0.5 1.5, meaning less half double mean price. simple check flags extreme values without relying standard deviation, can distorted outliers (World Bank 2013, 251). ratio−−average=pij/μj ratio--average = p_{ij}/\mu_j t-value test: ratio deviation individual price observation average reference quantity price product standard deviation product. pass test, ratio must 2.0 less (value greater 2.0 suspect falls outside 95 percent confidence interval). t−val=(pij−μPj)/σPj t-val = (p_{ij} - \mu_{P_j}) / \sigma_{P_j} Individual price quotes pass tests flagged price observation table. two statistics implemented OECD price statistics package OECD_SPPP. price observation table generated function valid_pot(), calls valid_r2a valid_tval. Example using UK CPI microdata
code: #Price Observation Table uk_pot <- uk_cpi |>   valid_pot()  head(uk_pot, n = 3) |>   gt() |>   tab_header(     title = md("**Price Observation Table**"),     subtitle = md("Example for `item_id` = 210111")   ) |>   fmt_number(     columns = c(       `Ratio-to-average price test`,       `T-value test`     ),     decimals = 1   ) uk_pot |>   select(     `Product code`,     `Ratio-to-average price test`:`T-value test`   ) |>   pivot_longer(`Ratio-to-average price test`:`T-value test`) |>   mutate(     is.outlier = case_when(name == "Ratio-to-average price test" & (value < 0.5 | value > 1.5) ~ "Test not passed",       name == "T-value test" & (value > 2) ~ "Test not passed",       .default = "Test passed"     ),     is.outlier = factor(is.outlier, levels = c("Test passed", "Test not passed"))   ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = value, fill = is.outlier)) +   facet_wrap(~name, scales = "free") +   geom_histogram() +   labs(     title = "Individual price outlier statistcs",     subtitle = "White sliced loaf branded 750G, 2018",     x = "",     fill = ""   ) +   theme_minimal()+   theme(legend.position = "top") #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. code: uk_irv <- uk_cpi |>   # Apply Price Observation Table checks   valid_pot() |>   # Condition on price quotes which pass the Price Observation Table tests   filter(!`Ratio-to-average price test FLAG` & !`T-value test FLAG`) |>   # Remove bimodal distribution   filter(`Ratio-to-average price test` > 0.8) |>   # Apply Average Price Table checks   valid_apt()  uk_irv |>   gt() |>   tab_header(     title = md("**Average Price Table**"),     subtitle = md("Example for `item_id` = 210111, **post-cleaning**")   ) |>   fmt_number(     columns = -c(Year, `Product code`),     decimals = 1   )
